results.name: Natural numbers in square maze arrangement, read by antidiagonals.
comment: Arrange the natural numbers by taking clockwise and counterclockwise turns. Begin (LL) and then repeat (RRR)(LLL).
a(n) is a pairing function: a function that reversibly maps Z^{+} x Z^{+} onto Z^{+}, where Z^{+} is the set of integer positive numbers. - _Boris Putievskiy_, Dec 16 2012
For generalizations see A219159, A213928. - _Boris Putievskiy_, Mar 10 2013

Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
example: The start of the sequence as table T(i,j), i,j > 0:
Enumeration by boustrophedonic ("ox-plowing") method: If i >= j: T(i,i)=(i-1)^2+i + (i-j)*(-1)^(i-1), if i  < j: T(i,j)=(j-1)^2+j - (j-i)*(-1)^(j-1). - _Boris Putievskiy_, Dec 19 2012
